channel.title: Comments on: Getting the list of parameters from a stored procedure by using sqlCmd.Parameters or INFORMATION_SCHEMA.parameters
channel.description: A Technical Community for IT Professionals

item.title: By: SQLNightOwl
item.dc:creator: SQLNightOwl
item.description: I've always been a fan of using a Data Access Layer that "hydrates" a SQL Command with all the Parameters, data types and directions. This allows the developers to call a method on the DAL, retrieve the command, set the parameter values, execute it and retrieve any results/outputs. Additionally, I've always added the return value so that this little known feature (in the app dev world) can be used.<br /> <br />
